item.title: How to generate submodules
item.description: Suppose we have a project named ‘flower’ with different people working on it. Suppose some other team already created a repository named ‘Rose’ which can add as a sub directory under our existing ‘flower’ repository. git submodule add https://github.com/<user>/rose rose At this point, you’ll have a rose folder inside flower, but if you were to check inside that folder, depending on your version of Git, you might see … nothing. Newer versions of Git will do this automatically, but older versions will require you to explicitly tell Git to download the contents of rose:
